comments.body: Yo construi uno de jungla pe
U guys should make a new kind of house like example there is a black smith and stuff

There should only be one Atlantis with a gigantic city and a giant castle in the middle of it no guardians no elder guardians but like underwater gollom’s that can swim after people that would attack villagers.

I think it would be interesting if it was like the woodland mansion where there is a special mob(s) or other dangers that spawns inside the castle and would discourage people from living in it. I also think it could have more traps, but near treasure rooms

405996079872

that actually sounds quite nice, maybe make it have tons of zombies in it or villager zombies

I wouldn't have an actual castle, but it would be cool if there is a ruined castle wall high on snowy mountains. Part of the wall would be collapsed, and you could find parts of the foundation buried. Strays could act as snipers in watch towers
Minecraft está ambientado en la Edad Media, así que estaría genial un castillo aunque esté en ruinas
we need more structures in Minecraft I would ask for more new buildings like a pillager factory or clouds that have rare items but for now an adventures dangerous fortress with new mobs to takle.
Sounds pog
Haha, I like this idea.

This is a great addition to minecraft because finding nether fortresses is hard, and it usually requires optifine, something vanilla purists don't want to use. However, I want the baby piglin to actually move to find it and when it does, it will point to it. To make it not overpowered, the baby will ask for more gold items along the journey and when the journey ends, no other baby piglins can "find" the found fortress.
good idea
thanks. I had another idea that would go nicely with this: dark lurkers.

This would be a good biome to incorporate the necromancers from Minecraft Dungeons. As a trophy item the player could defeat a necromancer to claim a reaper scythe. It would be cool if Minecraft actually had caskets for the graves. Can you imagine all sorts of undead mobs popping out of their caskets while the players trying to clollect loot from a chest.
I think it should be a gargantuan biome size structure stretching from almost the top of the world all the way down to the deep dark
true
VOTE!

Good idea but there should be more of a reward, as an example:

%10 chance of there being a random netherite tool and/or armor in a average blacksmith chest

%70 chance of finding a red shulker box hidden somewhere in the room

These are just some ideas, but in my opinion this would add a lot to your idea.
Well, there's Pigstep. Not that it's crucial to gameplay, but the beats are fire (bad pun intended).
I think it should be something gold...

I’ve played quite some snapshot survival lately and I have found bastions interesting enough (at least for my debatably low standarts). But this is still a good idea and I wouldn’t complain about a treasure item related to potions or gold (or even both).
Personally, I think it should be a new weapon, like with the trident for update aquatic. Perhaps a hammer, but I'm not sure.
It should be the brute’s shoulderpiece- a type of armor

Bastions are the only place with netherite in their loot table, and chains too, as well as pigstep. So while none of that is unique, it definitely gives the player an incentive to go to the bastions. Also, the other day I was on the edge of a soul sand valley and a nether wastes, a piglin got killed by a skeleton, guess what it dropped? Pigstep! Hilarious! Right?...
Unique treasure you mean netherite, snout banner pattern, and pigstep.

The ravagers could stay in iron or obsidian cages together with normal cows, for a totally different idea there could be houses with basements where the villagers are caged or are slaves. There may be achievements that consist of freeing the slave village and villagers.
Ravegers should be in a stable so theat pillagers could use them for battle
I feel like there should be hanging villagers from trees
I saw a post like this but the achivement was called "oh the places you will go" and it was somewhat different.
Name it better and it will be a great new advancement.
This would add some much needed variation to oak forests and oak trees in general.

Awesome!!! Minecraft needs this. It would make the game have a rich fantasy and magical feel to it. We NEED Ancient Oak Forest! After all, we have dark oak forests and then just oak forests. Oak trees (the ordinary ones) should be renamed apple trees.

Absolutely agreed.

All the current oak forests are pretty underwhelming, and this would definetely help fix that.

I do not agree with the mob customisation with biomes because I think that they might look a bit weird. As an amateur Speed-runner myself, I 100% agree with nether fortresses being WAY too rare. I could wander around a nether for 20 minutes and not find one where in 1.15 I could find a Nether fortress without any issues.

I like the idea but would suggest a cut on the size. In my opinion five floors serve the purpose but would look a little better. Also there is not as much space in the nether which makes placing them rather difficult.
What if this hung from the nether roof?
Endermen canonically traverse dimensions. How do they get to the overworld?
It would certainly add to the lore of Minecraft.  These structures could maybe have a very rare chance of spawning in the Warped Forests.
Reading the title it sounds like a bad idea, but if they were broken and didn't work, it would be really cool. Endermen can teleport.
I thought this idea was bad at first but now i like it this could, like  mali,kewl.pool said add to minecraft lore
Gei

I wanna be where the people are~
I wanna see, wanna see them dancing- okay I'll stop.

Seriously this would be neat tho.
It is an interesting idea, perhaps the colored dolphins could have the possibility to mount them.

There should be actuall Minecraft mermaids too

And a mermaid kingdom , the mermaids will speak to u if they see you , give you a special necklace, so u will turn into a mermaid to , when u go back on land , u will go back to u were. There should be sea monsters if u go deep enough, and if come across on in the kingdom, there will be mermaid nights to help u save the kingdom, everytime u do , u will get an achievement and when u complete five mishions , u will be able to keep the necklace forever . And that is it.
It could be abandoned as any mer-people would have fled long ago (due to the drowned) or gone extinct (same reason) but wouldn't have gotten zombified due to a conflicting type of magic.

I really like the idea, it would give us more incentive to go to the Nether rather then just going there for quartz and the fortress. I think more people need to see this so it can be expanded upon with other ideas.

I just thought of an idea. The Nether Spire could be used as a base-like structure that the Piglins can live in and around similar to how wither skeletons spawn in Nether fortresses. As we saw from Minecon, Piglins and wither skeletons fight so maybe having the Spire as a separate structure could make their relationship with each other like that of illagers and villagers.
I love the idea! I hope it gets in.
382733141031 - Please don't start rumors about Mob D. It's not happening.

I’ve reconsidered my comment and here’s my new suggestion. Now that the Nether Update is coming out Mojang has a reason to add the Nether Spire as a structure. In my opinion rather than have the Nether Reactor Core spawn something, just have the four soul sand for the wither spawn in the boss room. It gives players a reason to fight the wither in the Nether and all they would have to do is get the 3 wither skeleton skulls.
What about a map to find it? From the cartographer villager.

Talking about "Only reach it with Elytra"

Why would you need Elytra if you can glide and boost faster than hot air balloon, and Elytra is more rare. I'd say you can reach it if you have speed potion 2.

First of all of sounds more like a mob than a structure! So instead of a moving h.a.b. (Hot air balloon) it is a stationary one made of blocks that is either floating very high up or appears to have crashed. The still floating h.a.b. Could be guarded by flying enemies but have great loot while the crashed one has no guards and seems to be partially looted
Hey, this would be great they could add it along with the cool new mountain generation! It could be like a woodland mansion but for villagers!
Also, the corrupt version sounds like it was either infected and everyone was turned into illagers. Or, illagers raided it and took over.
And also, fishing gives more items when you fish in archeology sites.
It wold be so cool to have this idea

the idea for a curse is a good one but o have another idea for them like adding a few of them to the desert temple and to other structures like that and maybe more types of desert structures like a abandoned desert village or at lest make them more comin in deserts and make them more like the sea rewenas.
sorry I meant to have a I instead of a o
The reason why they have done this is because of the new bastion remnants. If they were made more common, they would be more likely to spawn near or inside each other.
this is already a suggestion.
I have been playing on a world since the 1.16 betas and have yet to find a nether fortress.
The nether fortresses are all I find, bastions seem rarer to me even though they're not
Yeah I like that Idea
Yes! Xbox switch and ps4 would also get more map variety for free mostly anyway
That would be great, because sometimes I want to find a fox family, not just one fox!

I really like this idea! However, I feel like instead of actively creating dens, there should just be naturally generating structures that are dens. So in cold biomes there could be polar bear dens as little caves. In taigas there could be a fox den. In deserts there could be rabbit dens. Etc. This would really add to the environment!
This would make the world really come alive!
Great idea! Though does this mean that it can't be crafted anymore?

They can still be crafted, but they're currently expensive since you have to barter with piglins. This well structure offers an alternative to bartering with piglins. Note that you can also get crying obsidian from the structure, so it becomes easier to make a new respawn anchor.
I don't know whether having a naturally spawning respawn anchor makes sense, but it is a good idea to have a structure in the soul sand valleys.
Cool. I like the idea that it isn't to common.
I would have End Crystal explosions turn obsidian into crying obsidian
